result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert William Nixon

records.addlTxt: 1:08 PM Defendant Robert William Nixon in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Robert William Nixon.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

9:31 AM Defendant Robert William Nixon in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Robert William Nixon.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  State calls Officer Yaeger - S&T.  Record reflects witness identified DE.  Atty Stroud cross exams.  State re-directs.  Court asking Officer Yaeger clarifying questions.  No questions from either counsel.  State requests bind over.  Atty Stroud objects to bind over.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  State requests and arraignment date. Matter reset.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert William Nixon in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Robert William Nixon.  Still awaiting test results.  Reset.  Requests preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:18 PM Defendant Robert William Nixon by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Kathryn E Hayes by Zoom audio and video.   Defendant Robert William Nixon in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for public defender representation.  Atty Hayes updates DE's address.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends a signature bond.  Atty Hayes does not object.  $5,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  No bars, taverns or liquor stores.  No possession of alcohol, absolute sobriety if operating MV and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
